sentence.Network_en: The Odyssey tells what happened to the Greek heroes after the sack of Troy.
sentence.Network_cn: 《奥德赛》讲述的是在特洛伊被洗劫一空之后发生在希腊英雄们身上的故事。

sentence.Network_en: Note how Telemachus in the Odyssey silences his mother.
sentence.Network_cn: 只要读一下《奥德赛》,就可以看到特里曼珠是怎样打断他母亲的话并要求她缄默.

sentence.Network_en: The march to Travnik was the final stretch of a 16-hour odyssey.
sentence.Network_cn: 去特拉夫尼克的这段路是长达16小时艰险旅行的最后一程。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: via Latin from Greek Odusseia (see Odyssey)

entry.def: An odyssey is a long exciting journey on which a lot of things happen.

example.ex: The march to Travnik was the final stretch of a 16-hour odyssey.
example.tran: 去特拉夫尼克的这段路是长达16小时艰险旅行的最后一程。

means.word_mean: 1. a long wandering and eventful journey
